alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Columbiana; Coshocton; Guernsey; Harrison; Jefferson; Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 5:28PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT HARRISON...NORTHERN JEFFERSON...WESTERN COLUMBIANA...NORTHWESTERN GUERNSEY...COSHOCTON...NORTHERN MUSKINGUM...CARROLL AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES... At 527 PM EST, an intense snow band was located along a line extending from Louisville to 6 miles southwest of Loudonville. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with these snow showers. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, Steubenville, New Philadelphia, Dover, Coshocton, Uhrichsville, Carrollton, Freeport, Wintersville, Newcomerstown, Minerva, Dennison, Strasburg, West Lafayette, Sugarcreek, North Zanesville, Dresden, Frazeysburg, Augusta, and Salineville. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 54 and 95. Snow will lead to reduced visibilities and hazardous travel conditions. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this intense snow shower. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Columbiana; Coshocton; Guernsey; Harrison; Jefferson; Muskingum; Tuscarawas
